labels.analysis: The MCP Server is focused on integrating with the Oura API to fetch health-related data such as sleep, readiness, and resilience metrics. The tools provided allow users to retrieve specific data points for given date ranges or for the current day. This server primarily serves as a bridge between users and the Oura API, enabling access to health and wellness insights.
labels.reasoning: The server's functionality is closely tied to health and fitness tracking, specifically with sleep and readiness data. This aligns well with the "Health & Fitness" category. Given that it is an API integration server, "API Integration" also makes sense as a secondary category. There is no unique functionality that warrants a custom label.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.overview: Access sleep, readiness, and resilience data from the Oura API.

tools.name: get_sleep_data
tools.description: Deploy Server Oura API Integration Server Claim Server @tomekkorbak/oura-mcp-server Try in Playground get_sleep_data

tools.name: get_readiness_data
tools.description: Get readiness data for a specific date range. Args: start_date: Start date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) end_date: End date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) Returns: Dictionary containing readiness data

tools.name: get_resilience_data
tools.description: Get resilience data for a specific date range. Args: start_date: Start date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) end_date: End date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) Returns: Dictionary containing resilience data

tools.name: get_today_sleep_data
tools.description: Get sleep data for today. Returns: Dictionary containing sleep data for today

tools.name: get_today_readiness_data
tools.description: Get readiness data for today. Returns: Dictionary containing readiness data for today

tools.name: get_today_resilience_data
tools.description: Get resilience data for today. Returns: Dictionary containing resilience data for today

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@tomekkorbak/oura-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
